description: Influenza viruses are members of the Orthomyxoviridae family, of which there are seven generas: Alphainfluenzavirus (influenza A virus), Betainfluenzavirus (influenza B virus), Gammainfluenzavirus (influenza C virus), Deltainfluenzavirus (influenza D virus), Isavirus, Quaranjavirus and Thogotovirus. Influenza A and B viruses co-circulate annually during seasonal epidemics and can cause severe respiratory disease in humans; influenza C virus infections lead to very mild symptoms in humans, while influenza D viruses infect only animals.
name: Influenza B Virus (IBV) Antibodies and Antigens
